intro: Melientha acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved melientha, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually narrow and pointed. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
